Vehicle.title: Vehicle
Vehicle.description: Represents a vehicle available for booking in the transportation company's fleet.

model.description: The model name of the vehicle (e.g., LiXiang L7).

description.description: A detailed description of the vehicle.

capacity.description: The passenger capacity of the vehicle.

features.description: A list of features offered by the vehicle (e.g., 'Airport transfer', 'Excursions', 'Air conditioning').

Booking.title: Booking
Booking.description: Represents a booking made by a customer for a vehicle.

bookingDate.description: The date and time for which the booking is made.

contactMethod.description: The preferred contact method chosen by the customer (Telegram, WhatsApp, Call).

message.description: Any optional message the customer may provide regarding the booking

Customer.title: Customer
Customer.description: Represents a customer who makes bookings.

params.name: vehicleId
params.description: The unique identifier of the vehicle.

params.name: customerId
params.description: The unique identifier of the customer.  This ID is also used as the document ID to associate users to customer data.

definition.description: Stores booking information for each customer. Includes 'customerId' to ensure authorization independence and simplify security rules.

params.name: customerId
params.description: The unique identifier of the customer making the booking.

params.name: bookingId
params.description: The unique identifier of the booking.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure is designed to manage vehicle bookings for a transportation company. It prioritizes authorization independence and simplifies security rules.  The structure includes collections for `vehicles`, and `customers`, as well as a subcollection for `bookings` under each customer. 

Authorization Independence: Authorization Independence is achieved by storing bookings under the customer document and requiring the `customerId` inside of the booking document. This allows us to confirm the current authenticated user owns the booking. This structure eliminates the need for `get()` calls in security rules.

QAPs Support: QAPs is achieved by storing each booking document under the `customers/{customerId}/bookings/{bookingId}` path, allowing only authenticated users to list booking documents under their path. The structure implements path-based ownership for customer data and their respective bookings.
